Ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah, ah.
Johnny the boxer, he hadn't been beat.
He was king of the ring, yeah, dancing feet.
His best friend, Louie, was an underworld mole.
He sneaked around the clubs and bars of old Soho.
One day, Louie, he got drunk as hell.
His tongue slipping badly, he began to tell about a killing
machine, a man named Clute, who murdered for money and
stashed the loot.
Sing, sha-da-da-na-na-na-na.
Sha-da-da-na-na-na-na.
Sha-da-da-na-na-na.
Sha-da-da-na-na-na.
Early next morning, a body was found in a pool of blood,
Louie faced down in the ground.
When Johnny found out, well, he was wide as the wind.
He found out the killer and eradicated him.
In a neon alley behind a Peking duck, Johnny heard the word
about the man called Clute.
Where can I find him?
He asked the Chinaman.
He can't hear a reply.
He'll find you instead.
He said, sha-da-da-na-na-na-na.
Sha-da-da-na-na-na-na.
Sha-da-da-na-na-na.
Sha-da-da-na-na-na.
Oh, ll accompany his gun.
So Johnny Hallenwell in his downtown jail.
Treated like a tiger, a beast caged in With an iron door and vengeance in his heart.
Tension rose like a thermometer as he waited for clue
Ten days passed without a word or a sign Then a black shadow walked in, just before closing time.
Johnny was alone, shadowboxing When a clue pulled out a blade
And plunged it in, he sang, Sha-na-na-na-na-na-na-ow
Sha-na-na-na-na-na-na-ow
Johnny keeled over, blood gushing from his side
Clue leapt over the ropes, red rage in his eyes
He raised the blade above his head
He grinned wickedly, thinking this one's dead
But Johnny spun round like a spinning top
He knocked clue off his feet, and down he dropped
He hit the canvas with a terrible thud
From his motionless body spilled a pool of blood
He sang, Sha-na-na-na-na-na-na-ow
